public_information: Puzzle: Tower of Hanoi with three pegs named left, middle, and right.
Disks labeled A (smallest), B, C, D (largest).
Rules: move one disk at a time and never place a larger disk on top of a smaller one.
Initial configuration: left peg top-to-bottom A, B, C, D; middle peg empty; right peg empty.
Goal configuration: right peg top-to-bottom A, B, C, D; left and middle pegs empty.

report.system_prompt: You are an observer of the left peg in a Tower of Hanoi instance with 4 disks. Provide a concise structured report of the peg contents (top-to-bottom) and note any observations or constraints you see. Do not produce PDDL.
report.prompt: Agent left_observer: Use the public information {environment->public_information} and your private information {agents->left_observer->private_information} to produce a concise structured state report labeled state_left that lists the disks top-to-bottom and any relevant peg constraints. This report will be consumed by the orchestrator to build a planning model.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling and planning for FastDownwards. Integrate the observers' structured state reports into a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem tailored for the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If representing multiple agents or sources, keep their actions or origins distinct in comments or action naming where appropriate.
pddl.prompt: Orchestrator: Using the public information {environment->public_information} and the observers' reports {state_left}, {state_middle}, {state_right}, produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that model the Tower of Hanoi with pegs left, middle, right and disks A B C D where A is smallest and D is largest. The domain should include actions to move a single disk from one peg to another with preconditions preventing larger-on-smaller placements. The problem should encode the initial state (left top-to-bottom A B C D, middle empty, right empty) and the goal state (right top-to-bottom A B C D, left and middle empty). Target the FastDownwards solver. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
